intro: Carmichaelia uniflora var. suteri, commonly known as the Suter's flaxflower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences. It thrives in coastal and subalpine habitats, often growing in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
